byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from Mumbai.

abstract: Sec of State John Kerry prepares final bid for Israeli-Palestinian peace accord in speech that will build on 2014 failed attempt and include subtle rebuke of Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu; remarks follow Israeli outrage over United States abstention from United Nations resolution denouncing Israel's ongoing building of West Bank settlements.

headline.print_headline: Kerry to Outline Vision of Israeli-Palestinian Accord
headline.main: John Kerry, in a Final, Pointed Plea, Will Outline a Vision of Mideast Peace

snippet: Mr. Kerry will use his remarks to confront Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel after bitterness over a United Nations resolution, a State Department official said....
lead_paragraph: Mr. Kerry will use his remarks to confront Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel after bitterness over a United Nations resolution, a State Department official said.
